runs.comm: full length on the off stump, swings in a little, driven firmly to extra-cover
pretty much same again, firm drive straight to extra-cover
better length, bang on off stump again, angled out to backward point
touch fuller, pressed into the covers, they take on extra-cover steaming in and had he thrown down the bowler's stumps, van Wyk was gone
decent area again, blocked back to the bowler
full toss, swings in a little and takes a thick inside edge that quirts up to mid-on
pushed way down leg and out of the reach of the diving Fletcher, with the mitts today in place of Ramdin
not quite as far but still a leg side wide
adjusts very nicely to seam one away and beat the outside edge
wide line, gently cut but in the air and dropped by a diving backward point going up with a left-hand at full stretch, only got a fingertip to it
too far outside off stump this time, driven at and missed
slightly tighter line and driven successfully this time, really well timed through point
gets it right again and beats the bat with a little extra bounce, batsman trying to back foot drive
fuller length and driven, rather off the splice into the covers
touch wider, guided away through point, this has pinged off the bat, what timing, only a gentle push and it screams away
full and a touch wide, driven to point who only parries and they get a single
tighter line, swings in a little, played forward to and gets a thick inside edge down to long leg
touch outside off again and eased through the covers
off stump line, van Wyk tried to stay leg side to carve off side but it swings in and takes an inside edge up the wicket
wider line and very full, driven on the bounce back to a leaping bowler
similarly wide line, driven wildly at and missed
back of a length and pulled with great timing over square leg, superb stroke, back quickly and lifted perfectly over the infield
fuller length, poked at and gets a thick inside edge to the left of short long leg for a single
length, slightly straight and picked up over deep square! What a shot, picked up and lifted into the stands, great shot
tries to go down the ground now to a fuller ball but gets only thin air
gets this up though and whacks it over extra-cover, timed well again and this carries all the way for another six
straighter line, tries to whip leg side, gets a thick leading edge into the covers but it luckily lands short of the fielder
another leading edge, this flies to point who drops it diving to his right, not the toughest chance really, reaching across to his right got two hands there, couldn't cling on
premeditated paddle from outside off, not much of a connection but gets it in front of short long leg for a single
length outside off, throws the kitchen sink at it and gets a whirls of a top edge straight to third man but it's just over his head, more luck for the batsman, fielder couldn't quite leap up in time
straighter ball and just blocked in front of the stumps
good length on a fourth-stump line, this is angled down to third man safely this time
back of a length and pulled for six more, no-one down at long leg so it's safe but carries all the way anyway
straight line, flicked fine of short long leg, fielder gets back to field on the rope but ends up making a right hash of the drag back and lets the ball roll into the rope
short and wide and cracked through cover, awful delivery
wide but very full and missed with Hendricks trying to drive through cover
tighter line at last, dropped into midwicket, the bowler sprints out to prevent two with all the fielders back
tries a reverse paddle and misses a quicker ball just outside off
another attempt, this time stuck on the pad but outside the line of off stump
full on the pads, clipped down to long leg
straighter line, driven back to the bowler who saves well getting down quickly to his left
slower ball, cuts away from van Wyk's attempted guided down towards third man

full on a straight line, picked up over the leg side again, towards the short boundary, it's gone very high and once again just out of the reach of deep square leg, Russell almost able to lean over the boundary to take the catch but it was just out of his reach
slower again, picked on the off stump, driven firmly but straight to extra-cover
slower ball once more, well outside off, van Wyk's leans right across to paddle it fine of short third man, gets a great connection on it and it races away to the fence
back of a length just outside off, punched to deep cover
lower full toss just outside off, gets it away from the sweeper this time
short and wide and steered past extra cover, awful delivery again from Nurse
around the wicket but short again, van Wyk backs away a little to cut hard past point once more
tries again, slightly tighter line and length this time, only finds point with more of a dab
fuller length, pressed forward straight to extra-cover this time
slower ball on the off stump, clipped into the leg side, just a single with long-on up quickly
cutter into off stump, batsman stays leg side of it and cuts down to third man
back of a length just outside off, punched out to deep cover
another slower ball, fuller and straighter, clipped out to deep square
another cutter, just dabbed to the right of the bowler and they take an easy single
full pace this time, yorker length but down leg
back to slower balls, batsman goes to flick leg side and gets struck on the pad
full length on off stump - already better, flicked to extra-cover off a bit of a leading edge
straight line whipped out to deep midwicket
slightly wide, batsman rocks back and cuts to point
fuller, flicked down to long-on
length on the stumps, tucked out square to deep midwicket this time
forward, flicked wide of the bowler and single brings van Wyk's fifty up in 35 balls
cutter on a full length, dropped into the covers and they take a sharp single, getting home comfortably
slower ball just outside off, dropped behind backward point for a sharp single, had the fielder gathered he might have made he close but it was fumbled
full pace, back of a length, goes to pull and misses
fuller ball, pressed to extra-cover this time, in fact just wide of the fielder so they get one
very slow outside off, poked at and missed a foot or so outside off stump
excellent yorker on middle and leg, batsman goes jolly well to dig it out
only just back of a length, cut into the gap at cover and that brings the hundred up
similar length but straighter and pulled out to deep square
back outside off, van Wyk backs away and lifts it over extra-cover, incredible timing, only just short of going for six
forward dropping a fuller ball wide of short third man
straight line and worked out to deep midwicket
tad short and pulled again, straight to deep square
slower ball on middle and off, whipped out to deep midwicket
yorker from very wide on the crease, dug out to deep midwicket
full on off stump, driven out steadily to deep cover

slower ball on the stumps, lifted leg side and hasn't got enough on this and deep midwicket takes the catch coming a few yards off the rope to take a straightforward catch. Hendricks had been quiet for a little bit and falls trying to force the pace and Nelson strikes
slower, good length on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
wide on the crease, full ball on the stumps flicked down to long leg
back of a length, slapped down to long-on
flat ball on the stumps, flicked out to deep midwicket and they come back for an easy two
full just outside off, pleasantly driven to extra-cover
stays back in the crease and angles straight to short third man, they get a quick single
touch short, back and placing a nice cut behind point
tighter line, cut down to long-off backing away to leg a little
length just outside off, slower ball, guided to short third man's right and he gets across to save well
length on the off stump, pressed forward and gets it out through the covers
cutter on middle and off, driven through cover
back of a length but drifting down leg and the pull misses
slower ball too wide outside off, Wiese throws the bat at it and carves it over backward point
yorker just outside off, dug out down to long-on, no second available
another excellent yorker, dug out back to the bowler
back of a length, pulled well but within reach of deep midwicket going to his right
fuller, whipped leg side again, this time straight to deep square
back of a length just outside off, punched only straight to backward point
shorter, good surprise delivery, goes to hook and misses, beaten for pace
very full on the stumps, driven straight to long-on
length just outside off, driven at and gets a thick outside edge that flies over short third man, not the field to bowl with width outside off stump
length on the stumps, lifted down towards deep square without too much timing who gets around to his right to save the boundary, the charge back for the second, it was a poor thrown
straight line, no timing again, this is straight to deep midwicket trying to go big again
full on off stump, slapped over extra-cover but the sweeper comes to his right to save four, just another couple
full on off stump, clean strike down the ground keeping the left leg out of the way, poor length really, very hittable
in the slot again, lifted over extra-cover this time, didn't time it and deep cover, despite a brief slip, saves four
slower ball on the stumps, slapped hard down the ground, long-on going to his left in a hurry saves the boundary with a slide, well fielded
cutter just a little wide, cut but only straight to the cover sweeper
too full and wide enough to swing through it, lovely strike over extra-cover, nailed that, once bounce four
swings hard again at a ball wide of off stump, it was slower, comes off a thick outside edge and runs slowly down to third man
full, slower ball, a foot outside off, van Wyk tries to cut and misses completely
length ball angled in, strikes the thigh pad that runs up on the off side for them to take a single

superb yorker, angled in from wide on the crease, beats the batsman for pace and bowls him! Gets it bang on line, cramping Wiese for room looking to clip leg side, it tailed in a bit too, striking the boot and deflecting the ball into the middle and leg stumps, excellent delivery. Not a wild impact from the promoted Wiese
full toss wide of off, slapped down the ground and they tear back for a second that shouldn't have been on, it went straight to the fielder
misses the yorker and this is swung down the ground, lovely smooth strike through the line, timed well, straight over the bowler's head
angled in from around the wicket, van Wyk across his stumps to use the pace and lift this over square leg, lovely pick up shot again
fuller just outside off, pressed in front of backward point for a single

back of a length, tries to heave it over the leg side but it's on him quickly and he slaps it straight up in the air, keeper v short long leg for the catch and it's Fletcher who takes it. Solid catch but had to nudge his team-mate out of the way to get there. Nowhere near the connection required from the batsman
forward dropping this in front of point for a single to keep the strike
beamer! Catches van Wyk on the hip looking to flick leg side, he's hurt. Hideous replay that's bounces straight back off the bone!

slower ball, dropped into the leg side and they take a sharp single and there's the century! A funny innings really, so quiet for the last 10 overs really but a fine innings nevertheless, the third South African to make a T20 international hundred
down the wicket and Duminy deposits his first ball back into the side over long-on, lovely strike, sails back
fuller length, driven to extra-cover and they sprint through for the run
slower ball outside off, picked up very early and driven into the stands over cover! What a shot, timed so well, just flicked at it and it sailed over the sweeper
full toss on the leg stump and this is flicked over long leg and all the way out of the ground! Two bounce on a tin rood and that ball is gone, picked up really well, just used the pace
much better ball, length on the stumps, only chipped down the ground for a couple
